column5: Hey gang, was wondering if anyone had any electronic copies of depth charts for some local lakes, namely Lake Niapenco reservoir. Read some chats about it online, but haven't found anything to back it up. I'm sure one of you lovely OFC members can share with me  Cheers!

As far as i know,these navionics cards are unable to be copied I did alot of searching on the web, and everything i have come up with says no.I even read that it may damage the original card. i could be wrong though.
You'd think there would be a way to upload them to your computer and print them out. I'd write the company.
I think your barking up the wrong tree,I don`t think they would have much of a business if one could copy and distribute!  I have the Navionics PC app and you can not print.
TrakMaps. Inexpensive and highly detailed. I have them for my area, and i use them before i gon on the water and in conjunction with my GPS.They sell them at Sail and BPS.

Try anglersatlas.com.  There is a ton on charts for lakes.  Some more detailed than others but it worth a try.  I use it a lot for scouting and navigating on the water.  Its quick and easy to sign up and its....get this....FREE
That lake isn't on my navionics map...
Thanks, doesn't look like they have all that much for the lake i am looking for, but i signed up and found a couple that I can use  (y)(y)(y)
Cause with the iPhone you can do this in a couple seconds...
if you can get it on a computer  any Printscreen program will print a screen shot of the map from your computer monitor
Any questions about fishing electronics, Terry's your man !!

Is Garmin inland lakes for Ontario on a disc or easily found. I have no problem with a key I just need a copy of the software. If anyone knows where I can find one I am sure I have something I can swap for. Rob C
Of all the maps that is one I want and have never found
Thats good to know Lew. And i thought he was just another purdy face  Carry on
